definition: to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Populations also extend for considerable distances inland in regions with enough moisture to support suitable woodlands. The koala is not found in Tasmania or Western Australia.
sentences.chinese: 而在塔斯馬尼亞及西澳地區則沒有發現考拉。

sentences.english: There are rare animals in Australia , for instance, koalas and duckbills.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲有稀有動物，例如考拉熊和鴨嘴獸。

sentences.english: There are more than 130 species of marsupials, such as kangaroos, koalas, and wombats.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有130多種有袋目動物，像袋鼠，考拉和袋熊。

sentences.english: If the decline continues, koalas could be gone by 2040.
sentences.chinese: 按這個趨勢，考拉可能在2040年滅絕。

sentences.english: A heavy-lidded koala keeps its cool nestled in an Adelaide tree.
sentences.chinese: 一隻笨重的考拉舒適地倚在阿德萊德的一棵樹上。

sentences.english: The committee will make its next recommendation in mid-2010.
sentences.chinese: 該委員會將於2010年再把考拉提名到該物種類目。

sentences.english: Koalas usually sleep during the day, but get up and eat leaves at night.
sentences.chinese: 考拉通常白天睡覺，但晚上卻起來喫葉子。

sentences.english: S. has listed the koala bear as a threatened species.
sentences.chinese: 美國曾將考拉熊列爲瀕臨物種。

sentences.english: A kola is resting on the trunk.
A baby joey koala at Sydney's Wildlife World.
sentences.chinese: 一隻小考拉在悉尼野生世界。

sentences.english: People usually think pandas; koala bears are so cute and smart.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲熊貓，考拉熊是如此伶俐和聰明。

sentences.english: The koala is the glue for GTMS Team Australia, filling in whatever critical role is needed.
sentences.chinese: 考拉是澳大利亞隊的萬能膠，勝任任何關鍵的位置。

sentences.english: It's also home to the last recovering population of koalas on the state's Far South Coast.
sentences.chinese: 同時也是考拉熊在遠南威爾士沿岸繁衍的最後家園。

definition: zookeeper/stockman/breeder (of livestock, dogs or poultry etc)
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
